memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1607

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the Atlantic Yards
arena and redevelopment project

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
This bill would require that the Atlantic Yards arena and
redevelopment project (as defined in an MOU signed with ESDC on
February 18, 2005) be subject to ULURP.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Section 1 of the bill sets out the legislative intent.

Section 2 requires that the ULURP procedure as set forth in the City
Charter not be circumvented due to the fact that an agency of the
State (ESDC) is proposing to work with the private developer to build
the Atlantic Yards project.

Section 3 would require the Atlantic Yards project to be halted while
the ULURP process was followed on an expedited schedule.
Section 4 sets forth an expedited schedule for ULURP in this instance
and requires a vote by the full City Council on those recommendations
on or before December 31, 2008.

Section 5 is the effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:
The ULURP process was included in the City Charter by a vote of the
citizenry of the city of New York to allow for a democratically
enacted urban land use procedure. This bill preserves that right in
this instance which would otherwise be circumvented due to the fact
that a state agency is involved in the planning and improvement of
this parcel of land known as the Atlantic Yards arena and
redevelopment project. Furthermore, community boards 2, 6 and 8 in
Brooklyn have previously requested that this project be subject to
the ULURP process.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
First introduced in 2008.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS TO STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT:
Undetermined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
